Posts.Content: Mar 10, 2008 10:48AM sharona wrote: I went for my mapping and tattoos today, it is quite surreal laying on that table, especially reminding myself I do not have cancer! I am really struggling with depression over all of this.  I cry easily, sleep terrible... I am taking short term disability for the duration of the treatments which officially begin Thurs. The rad people act like it should not interfere with work but my company is great and is OK with the break. As a sales rep in the pharmaceutical world, I have a lot of meetings, lunches, travel,etc. and I know I am not at my best right now.  That is the bad thing about sales, you really need to be on with your customers, they really are not there for you.  Also, I am so much older (50) than my sales team, I just struggle with having everyone in my business. I think the break will help me get a better mindset.  I just hope this is the right decision... Sharona
Posts.Title: March 2008 Rads Team brst26 juliajo

Posts.Content: Mar 13, 2008 03:52PM sharona wrote: Janice,  My first treatment was today also, I am definitly already red and so "aware of my left breast".  It is warm, not painful but then again it has been sensitive since the lumpectomy.  My rads team has not instructed me to do anything special.  I am not wearing underwires but wondering how important the creams, etc. really are?  I am having a glass of wine tonight, feeling really anxious and sad, probably will call my primary care if my sad mood continues. Sharona
Posts.Title: March 2008 Rads Team brst26 juliajo

Posts.Content: Mar 6, 2008 07:03PM sharona wrote: I go tomorrow for the beginning of this treatment process.  I am so thankful to find a group of others in the same boat.  I have really been sad toda- I accepted that radiation (instead of mastectomy), is my next step.  I decided to take a medical leave from work, mainly for my "spirits "and my company is OK with it.  I am in sales and really need to be "on", this diagnosis has me far from it. Sharon
Posts.Title: March 2008 Rads Team brst26 juliajo

Posts.Content: Mar 13, 2008 06:36PM sharona wrote: Janice, I will head out tomorrow for the lotion, etc.  I am disappointed with my rad center, no info like this at all.  I am so depressed, my eating has been awful.  Seeing your post makes me realize I do have some control here.  I took off work for the entire treatment period, I am not interested in sharing more than I absolutly have to.  I am in sales, and my depression has me really unable to get it together for my job.  Hopefully when I return, all of this will be a faint memory.  I noticed our diag. dates are really close.  Thanks for your help! Sharona
Posts.Title: March 2008 Rads Team brst26 juliajo

Posts.Content: Mar 20, 2008 05:15AM sharona wrote: I also took the time off work.  FYI: I was surprised that the radiation doctor did not support the decision on my paperwork.  I saw my primary care doc yesterday for the emotional mess I have been.  She agrees that I need this time off, and will document it for me for my short term disability.  She also set me up with counseling and put me on an antidepressent.  I hope it will help me shake the blues I have had. Actually, the treatments have gone very smoothly (I have had 5), I see the NP today. Sharona
Posts.Title: March 2008 Rads Team brst26 juliajo

Posts.Content: Mar 20, 2008 09:49PM sharona wrote: I know what everyone means by the anxiety.  My 24 year old son had an emergency appendectomy surgery Tues.  This, on top of all the rest, (I still can't even imagine how the death of a family member has been for Nanstoy).  Life is really coming at a lot of us. I am so disappointed in my rads group, still have had no contact with a doc and feel like they are really in a hurry to get me through each day. My boob is holding up pretty good condering all it has been through the past few weeks! Sharona
Posts.Title: March 2008 Rads Team brst26 juliajo

Posts.Content: Mar 22, 2008 06:41PM sharona wrote: My son is sore from the surgery but doing well.  The good news is he has been great company as he is staying with us for recovery (he is 24, single, working...so we do not normally see him too often).  Thanks for your concern.  Finally talked to the NP at my rads group, she says I am doing well. Happy Easter to all of the March rads team! Sharona
Posts.Title: March 2008 Rads Team brst26 juliajo

Posts.Content: Mar 8, 2008 04:15PM sharona wrote: I get started this week also.  My cat scan was Fri, markings on Monday and start the Tx on Wed.  They have not mentioned the gels and bras, is this irritation expected?  My doc acted like the 1st 2 weeks, very little change.  I wanted to do water areobics also, is that out of the question too?  I find it amazing that they don't tell you all of this before you start.  My primary care doc said these 6 weeks will fly by, I hope so. Sharona
Posts.Title: March 2008 Rads Team brst26 juliajo

Posts.Content: Mar 10, 2008 12:58PM sharona wrote: Thanks for the hugs..your comments are right on.  I know I am very lucky, my mom was stage 3 before they saw hers and her road was much harder.  That too is a little of the problem: the treatments (2 lumpectomies, 28 rad treatments and then tamox), seem like a nucleur bomb on an ant hill.  I just hope I don't regret not  going on with the mastectomy.  The choices you have for treatment of DCIS are wide ranged and it really comes down to comfort level for the patient.  If I have a reoccurence, the mastectomy will be my only option and these treatments put my odds down to about 12% over the next few years. Thanks for your help, this board is fantastic!  Sharona ps.I am also a swimmer as my knees wont tolerate much else. I will miss it but dont want to add more discomfort. I must be destined to be fat!
Posts.Title: March 2008 Rads Team brst26 juliajo

Posts.Content: Mar 13, 2008 10:02AM sharona wrote: Hey March team, I had my first treatment today, it really was not bad but I did feel  my tears running into my ears as I laid there.  I am so emotional right now...?  They also upset me as I was leaving, told me that tomorrow they can't get me in till 5:10pm (my appt was supposed to be @9:40am). That is past their closing time and I had a conflict. I could not argue as I was about to break down.  This is definiy not normal for me, I am afraid I am really depressed.  I am hoping this anxiety will decrease soon.  Good luck everyone! Sharon
Posts.Title: March 2008 Rads Team brst26 juliajo

Posts.Content: Mar 15, 2008 07:43AM sharona wrote: I have had 2 treatments, already red and hot (I am not fair skinned but really sensitive to sunburn).  I am heading out this morning for some cotton comfort, that will help conceal my bra-lessness!  I have used the aquaphor and ivory soap. I am also really swollen.  This is probably from the combo of lumpectomy and rads.  So far, the affected boob is larger than the other one! Yes, the tattoos are permanent..mine are tiny. Sharona
Posts.Title: March 2008 Rads Team brst26 juliajo

Posts.Content: Mar 27, 2008 05:10AM sharona wrote: I have had 11tx so far and the fatigue has really hit.  I too slept almost all day yesterday.  I have also had some nausea and headache, anyone else?  ( I recently started lexapro for depression so I am not sure if it is a se from this or the rads). My skin looks pretty good but my breast is very swollen and heavy. Sharona
Posts.Title: March 2008 Rads Team brst26 juliajo

Posts.Content: Apr 20, 2008 02:31PM sharona wrote: March  girls, Tomorrow is also my last day of rads.  We are leaving for a week at the beach in celebration, then back to work and goodbye to bc till I start the tamox in June.  I guess I will join a new group then.  This board has been very helpful for me, thanks for all the input.  My best wishes to everyone that has had to deal with all of this, it has really changed my life and honestly, a few ways for the better.  We all know not to sweat the small stuff...thank God for each day we have with our families and friends! Sharona
Posts.Title: March 2008 Rads Team brst26 juliajo
